clusters.neutral_headline: Worker Dies After Medieval Tower Collapse in Rome

items.title: Worker dies after partial collapse of medieval tower in Rome
items.standfirst: The man was trapped for several hours after part of the Torre dei Conti, on the edge of the Roman Forum, gave way.
items.content: The man was trapped for several hours after part of the Torre dei Conti, on the edge of the Roman Forum, gave way.

items.title: Worker dies in Italy after rescue from partially collapsed medieval tower
items.standfirst: The Romanian worker was trapped for hours under the rubble following the partial collapse of Rome's Torre dei Conti.
items.content: The Romanian worker was trapped for hours under the rubble following the partial collapse of Rome's Torre dei Conti.

items.title: Worker dies after Rome's medieval Torre dei Conti tower partially collapses
items.standfirst: The 13th century Torre dei Conti in Rome partially collapsed during renovation work. One worker who was extracted from the rubble died soon after, officials said.
items.content: The 13th century Torre dei Conti in Rome partially collapsed during renovation work. One worker who was extracted from the rubble died soon after, officials said.

items.title: Worker dies after being rescued from partially collapsed medieval tower in Rome
items.standfirst: Romanian worker was taken to hospital in ‘serious condition’ after being saved from Torre dei Conti rubble, but died soon afterA Romanian worker who was trapped for hours under rubble in Rome after the partial collapse of a medieval tower has died in hospital, just a short time after he was pulled free by emergency services.“I express deep sorrow and condolences, on behalf of myself and the government, for the tragic loss of Octay Stroici, the worker who was killed in the collapse of the Torre dei Conti in Rome,” Italy’s prime minister Giorgia Meloni said in a statement after midnight. “​We are close to his family and colleagues at this time of unspeakable suffering.” Continue reading...
items.content: Romanian worker was taken to hospital in ‘serious condition’ after being saved from Torre dei Conti rubble, but died soon afterA Romanian worker who was trapped for hours under rubble in Rome after the partial collapse of a medieval tower has died in hospital, just a short time after he was pulled free by emergency services.“I express deep sorrow and condolences, on behalf of myself and the government, for the tragic loss of Octay Stroici, the worker who was killed in the collapse of the Torre dei Conti in Rome,” Italy’s prime minister Giorgia Meloni said in a statement after midnight. “​We are close to his family and colleagues at this time of unspeakable suffering.” Continue reading...

items.title: Worker dies after medieval tower collapses during renovation in Rome
items.standfirst: Rescuers in Rome on Monday pulled alive a worker trapped when a medieval tower partly collapsed during renovation, city authorities said. The man was taken to hospital with injuries. Prefect Lamberto Giannini described the effort as a “long rescue mission.”
items.content: Rescuers in Rome on Monday pulled alive a worker trapped when a medieval tower partly collapsed during renovation, city authorities said. The man was taken to hospital with injuries. Prefect Lamberto Giannini described the effort as a “long rescue mission.”

items.title: Medieval tower partially collapses in the heart of Rome
items.standfirst: The Torre dei Conti partially collapsed in Rome during renovations, critically injuring one worker and trapping another.
items.content: The Torre dei Conti partially collapsed in Rome during renovations, critically injuring one worker and trapping another.

items.title: Worker trapped under collapsed medieval tower for 11 hours dies
items.standfirst: A man who was trapped under the rubble of a collapsed medieval tower in central Rome has died.
items.content: A man who was trapped under the rubble of a collapsed medieval tower in central Rome has died.

ai_summary: A worker died after a partial collapse of the Torre dei Conti in Rome during renovations.
The worker was trapped under rubble for hours before being rescued by emergency services.
The worker was taken to the hospital but died shortly after being pulled from the rubble.
Italy's Prime Minister expressed condolences to the worker's family and colleagues.
The collapse occurred during renovation work on the 13th-century tower.

items.standfirst: Attention in US and abroad will be on New York mayoral race with Democratic candidate Zohran Mamdani facing Andrew Cuomo and Curtis SliwaThe US government shutdown on Tuesday entered its 35th day, matching a record set during Donald Trump’s first term for the longest in history.The last shutdown, which started in December 2018 and was brought about by disagreements over money to fund a wall along the US-Mexico border, lasted 35 days – the longest in American history (up until that point). items.title: New York City voters head to polls for closely watched mayoral election
items.standfirst: Race has gained national attention with Trump threatening to pull federal funds from the city if Zohran Mamdani winsNew York City voters are heading to the polls on Tuesday in one of the most closely watched mayoral elections in the city’s history.Vying for the city’s top office are Zohran Mamdani, the 34-year-old democratic socialist and state assemblymember from Queens who is the Democratic nominee; Andrew Cuomo, the former Democratic governor running as an independent after losing to Mamdani in June’s primary; and Curtis Sliwa, the Republican candidate and founder of the Guardian Angels, a non-profit organization dedicated to “unarmed crime prevention”. Continue reading...
items.content: Race has gained national attention with Trump threatening to pull federal funds from the city if Zohran Mamdani winsNew York City voters are heading to the polls on Tuesday in one of the most closely watched mayoral elections in the city’s history.Vying for the city’s top office are Zohran Mamdani, the 34-year-old democratic socialist and state assemblymember from Queens who is the Democratic nominee; Andrew Cuomo, the former Democratic governor running as an independent after losing to Mamdani in June’s primary; and Curtis Sliwa, the Republican candidate and founder of the Guardian Angels, a non-profit organization dedicated to “unarmed crime prevention”. Continue reading...

items.title: 3 reasons why Zohran Mamdani could win New York’s mayoral race
items.standfirst: As New Yorkers cast their ballots, Zohran Mamdani stands out as the young, dynamic, and unapologetically progressive candidate energising voters with his bold agenda; tackling the cost of living, making childcare free, and raising taxes on the rich. His clear left-wing stance makes him a real challenge for President Trump, as this election looks like a dress rehearsal for the 2026 midterms.
items.content: As New Yorkers cast their ballots, Zohran Mamdani stands out as the young, dynamic, and unapologetically progressive candidate energising voters with his bold agenda; tackling the cost of living, making childcare free, and raising taxes on the rich. items.title: Is New York candidate Zohran Mamdani too far left?
items.standfirst: In New York’s mayoral race, Zohran Mamdani leads among young voters with bold plans to cut living costs and make public transport free. Backed by AOC and Bernie Sanders, the Democratic Socialist faces fierce attacks from President Trump, who calls him a “communist.” Some then wonder if Mamdani is too far left to win.

items.title: Trump threatens to cut federal funds for New York City if Mamdani wins mayoral race
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Monday said he would hold back federal funds for New York City if Democratic candidate Zohran Mamdani wins Tuesday's mayoral election. Trump urged New Yorkers to vote for former New York governor Andrew Cuomo, who is running as an independent after losing to Mamdani in the Democratic primary.

Trump urged New Yorkers to vote for former New York governor Andrew Cuomo, who is running as an independent after losing to Mamdani in the Democratic primary.

items.title: Trump weighs in on New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: In his "60 Minutes" interview, President Trump weighed in on the race for mayor of New York City. Mr. Trump has declined to endorse the Republican nominee, Curtis Sliwa, and calls the Democratic Party nominee, Zohran Mamdani, a communist. Ed O'Keefe is covering the race.

clusters.title: Afghans begin clean-up after powerful earthquake that killed 20
clusters.neutral_headline: Powerful Earthquake Hits Afghanistan, Killing at Least 20

items.title: Afghans begin clean-up after powerful earthquake that killed 20
Powerful Afghan earthquake leaves at least 20 dead and hundreds injured
items.standfirst: Northern provinces of Balkh and Samangan worst hit by magnitude 6.3 quake, which also damaged Mazar-i-Sharif’s Blue MosqueA powerful 6.3 magnitude earthquake shook northern Afghanistan before dawn on Monday, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 640 others, 25 critically, a disaster management official said. Health officials said the numbers could rise.The US Geological Survey said the quake’s epicentre was located 22km (14 miles) south-west of the town of Khulm, and that it struck at 12.59am at a depth of 28km (17 miles). Continue reading...
items.content: Northern provinces of Balkh and Samangan worst hit by magnitude 6.3 quake, which also damaged Mazar-i-Sharif’s Blue MosqueA powerful 6.3 magnitude earthquake shook northern Afghanistan before dawn on Monday, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 640 others, 25 critically, a disaster management official said. Health officials said the numbers could rise.The US Geological Survey said the quake’s epicentre was located 22km (14 miles) south-west of the town of Khulm, and that it struck at 12.59am at a depth of 28km (17 miles). Continue reading...

Plus, Xiaomi's pivot from smartphones to electric vehicles may have come at a human cost. And, Palantir’s earnings are expected to show continued excitement for AI and defense tech. items.title: ChatGPT owner OpenAI signs $38bn cloud computing deal with Amazon
items.standfirst: The seven-year agreement will see OpenAI gain access to Nvidia graphics processors to train its artificial intelligence models.
items.content: The seven-year agreement will see OpenAI gain access to Nvidia graphics processors to train its artificial intelligence models.

items.title: OpenAI signs massive AI compute deal with Amazon
items.standfirst: Deal will provide access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia chips that power ChatGPT.
items.content: On Monday, OpenAI announced it has signed a seven-year, $38 billion deal to buy cloud services from Amazon Web Services to power products like ChatGPT and Sora. It’s the company’s first big computing deal after a fundamental restructuring last week that gave OpenAI more operational and financial freedom from Microsoft. The agreement gives OpenAI access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia graphics processors to train and run its AI models. “Scaling frontier AI requires massive, reliable compute,” OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said in a statement. “Our partnership with AWS strengthens the broad compute ecosystem that will power this next era and bring advanced AI to everyone.” OpenAI will reportedly use Amazon Web Services immediately, with all planned capacity set to come online by the end of 2026 and room to expand further in 2027 and beyond. Amazon plans to roll out hundreds of thousands of chips, including Nvidia’s GB200 and GB300 AI accelerators, in data clusters built to power ChatGPT’s responses, generate AI videos, and train OpenAI’s next wave of models.Read full article Comments

items.title: Microsoft to Buy AI Computing Power From IREN for $9.7 Billion

items.content: Microsoft Corp. has signed a roughly $9.7 billion deal to buy artificial intelligence computing capacity from IREN Ltd., becoming the Australian company’s largest customer. Bloomberg's Caroline Hyde reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.content: Amazon Web Services has signed a $38 billion deal to supply OpenAI with computing power. This includes providing access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia graphics processing units. Bloomberg's Caroline Hyde reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Israel rocked by scandal as top military lawyer is thrown into jail

items.title: Israel top military lawyer arrested after she admitted leaking video of soldiers’ abuse
items.standfirst: Rightwing politicians and pundits have called the soldiers accused of attack on Palestinian detainee ‘heroes’ and military investigators traitors Police in Israel have arrested and detained the military’s top legal officer after she admitted leaking footage of soldiers allegedly attacking a Palestinian detainee and then in effect lying about her actions to Israel’s high court.The military advocate general, Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi, said in a resignation letter last week that she had authorised publication of the video to defuse attacks on military investigators and prosecutors working on the case. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The Maldives began implementing a smoking ban Saturday on anyone born on or after January 2007, making it the only nation with a generational prohibition on tobacco, the Health Ministry said.

clusters.title: Peru cuts diplomatic ties with Mexico over ex-PM's asylum claim

items.title: Peru cuts diplomatic ties with Mexico over ex-PM's asylum claim
items.standfirst: Lima denounced the decision to grant Betssy Chávez, an alleged co-author of an attempted coup, as an "unfriendly act".
items.content: Lima denounced the decision to grant Betssy Chávez, an alleged co-author of an attempted coup, as an "unfriendly act".

items.title: Peru severs diplomatic relations with Mexico after former prime minister claims asylum
items.standfirst: Peru's government has severed diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of former Peruvian prime minister Betssy ChávezPeru’s government has announced the country is severing diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of former Peruvian prime minister Betssy Chávez, who is under investigation for rebellion.Peruvian foreign minister Hugo de Zela told reporters that Mexico’s decision to grant Chávez asylum at its embassy in Peru’s capital, Lima, constituted an “unfriendly act” that adds to the existing tensions between the two countries. The office of Peru’s president José Jerí in a statement then accused Mexico’s government of “repeated” interference with the internal affairs of the South American country. Continue reading...
items.content: Peru's government has severed diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of former Peruvian prime minister Betssy ChávezPeru’s government has announced the country is severing diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of former Peruvian prime minister Betssy Chávez, who is under investigation for rebellion.Peruvian foreign minister Hugo de Zela told reporters that Mexico’s decision to grant Chávez asylum at its embassy in Peru’s capital, Lima, constituted an “unfriendly act” that adds to the existing tensions between the two countries. The office of Peru’s president José Jerí in a statement then accused Mexico’s government of “repeated” interference with the internal affairs of the South American country. Continue reading...

items.title: Peru cuts ties with Mexico over asylum for ex-prime minister
items.standfirst: Move comes after Betssy Chavez, who is on trial on coup charges, fled to the Mexican Embassy in Peru.
items.content: Move comes after Betssy Chavez, who is on trial on coup charges, fled to the Mexican Embassy in Peru.

items.standfirst: Sheffield Hallam University ordered professor to cease human rights study into Uyghurs forced labour in ChinaAn investigation into allegations that a British university was subjected to pressure from Beijing authorities to halt research about human rights abuses in China has been referred to counter-terrorism police.The Guardian reported on Monday morning that Sheffield Hallam University, home to the Helena Kennedy Centre for International Justice (HKC) research institution, had ordered professor Laura Murphy to cease research on supply chains and forced labour in the country in February. items.title: Mexican mayor killed during Day of the Dead celebrations
items.standfirst: Carlos Alberto Manzo Rodríguez, who was under police protection, was shot dead in front of dozens of peopleA mayor in Mexico’s western state of Michoacán was shot dead in a plaza in front of dozens of people who had gathered for Day of the Dead festivities, authorities have said.The mayor of the Uruapan municipality, Carlos Alberto Manzo Rodríguez, was gunned down Saturday night in the town’s historic centre. He was rushed to a hospital where he later died, according to state prosecutor Carlos Torres Piña. Continue reading...
